shiluv-raui.title: Proper Integration
shiluv-raui.content:
Principles and guidelines for proper integration in the IDF:

  • Prohibition of discrimination in tasks based on gender (male/female).
  • It is mandatory to have separate living quarters in the camp, in tents, and in the field for males and females.
  • Do not enter the living quarters of the opposite sex under any circumstances.
  • A soldier is forbidden to sleep alone in quarters without permission from the head of personnel.
  • At all hours of the day, it is mandatory to be in full military uniform.
  • During sports/outings, it is mandatory to wear appropriate civilian clothing.

bitachon-meida.title: Information Security
bitachon-meida.content:
Information security guidelines protect organizational information:

  • Do not bring civilian magnetic or optical media into army computers (discs, USB drives, hard drives, MP3 players, and any product containing a memory storage device, e.g., an iPad) and do not use civilian files and software.
  • It is strictly forbidden to bring civilian laptops into IDF bases.
  • It is forbidden to connect wireless keyboards to IDF computers.
  • Ensure that the responsibility for the computer is personal and that you protect it and the information it contains.

betichut.title: Safety
betichut.content:
Fire Fighting:

  • Throughout the base, there are fire extinguishing means for emergencies.
  • Do not use these fire hoses for any purpose other than their intended use!
  • Make sure to walk on sidewalks only, and in pedestrian areas - in the gray areas.

In case of emergency, act according to the instructions.

sherutey-hadat.title: Religious Services
sherutey-hadat.content:
Kosher:

The food produced for the army is under the kosher supervision of the Military Rabbinate.

Religious Items:

Religious items can be obtained from the unit's rabbinate: Hanukkiahs, Sabbath candles, tzitzit, prayer books, skirt permits, etc.

shabatot-vehagim.title: Sabbaths and Holidays
shabatot-vehagim.content:
Every soldier who wishes to do so has the right to observe the Sabbath/holiday. Activities on Fridays and holiday eves will end no later than one hour before the start of the Sabbath/holiday, to allow every soldier to prepare for the Sabbath/holiday.

  • There will be no entertainment activities on the Sabbath/holiday.
  • Sabbath/holiday evening meals will be festive, and a Kiddush will be held before the meal.
  • A female soldier who wishes to receive Sabbath candles should ask the unit rabbi/religious staff.

tzomot.title: Fasts
tzomot.content:
Every soldier who wishes to do so must be allowed to fast on the following fast days: Fast of Gedalia (3rd of Tishrei), Yom Kippur, 10th of Tevet, Fast of Esther (13th of Adar), 17th of Tammuz, and 9th of Av.

To receive the necessary response, if you encounter any problem or question during your service, you are invited to contact the unit rabbi.

hadar-ochel.title: Dining Hall
hadar-ochel.content:
There are 6 dining halls in the Training Base. A soldier may eat in any of them. In addition, fast food meals are served in FAST FOOD machines.

Dining Hall Opening Hours

Meal TypeOperating Hours
Breakfast06:30-08:00
Lunch11:30-14:00

Friday/HolidayOne hour from Sabbath/Holiday start

Response for Special Populations

Servings for special populations can be provided: allergens, celiacs, and mehadrin.

moked-merkazi.title: Central Hub and Phones
moked-merkazi.content:
The central hub is a control and monitoring center that can be contacted regarding notifications of malfunctions, needs, and information. The hub operates 24 hours a day, including weekends and holidays.

  • Civilian phone from guard: 073-3772000 / 106
  • Training Base Ops Room: 073-3772330

mispara.title: Barbershop
mispara.content:
Barbershop services for men/women are available to soldiers at the Training Base, free of charge, in accordance with army orders.

Barbershop Opening Hours:

  • Sun-Thu: 08:00 - 18:00
  • Fri & Holiday Eve: 08:00 - 12:00

Phone for appointment: 054-5562343

merkaz-mischari.title: Commercial Center
merkaz-mischari.content:
There is a commercial center at the Training Base for selling personal consumption products, including a supermarket, restaurants, gift shops, and more.

Vending machines for hot/cold drinks, snacks, and ice pops are available at the Training Base, 24 hours a day.

apsanaut.title: Quartermaster & Laundry
apsanaut.content:
The quartermaster's office holds all items the soldier is entitled to for the purpose of replacing worn-out items, office supplies, and cleaning materials.

Laundry and Ironing Services:

  • As part of soldier welfare, personal laundry items up to 20 items can be sent.
  • Class 'A' uniforms, bedding, towels, sheets, coats, personal wool vest, parka, skirt, etc.
  • Dropping off and picking up laundry will be done at the quartermaster's office.

sherutey-sport.title: Sports Services
sherutey-sport.content:
Fitness facilities, an aerobic gym, a spinning room, and a gym are available to the Training Base personnel.

Opening Hours:

  • Sun-Thu: 06:00 - 22:00
  • Fri: 06:00 - 13:00
  • All week: 06:30-09:00, 17:00-21:00

maarach-harefua.title: Medical Services
maarach-harefua.content:
Medical Center Opening Hours:

  • Sun-Thu: 08:00-17:30
  • An "evening clinic" operates at the center from 19:00 - 23:00 on Sun-Thu.

Additional Services:

  • Specialist medicine in core areas: orthopedics, dermatology, neurology, ENT, gynecology, and psychiatry.
  • A pharmacy is active on Sun-Thu from 08:00-17:30.

In case of a medical emergency only, call the Medical Center

0733772888, extension 9

info-services.title: Information Services
info-services.content:
Electronic Signage:

An electronic signage system operates at the Training Base to provide relevant and up-to-date information.

Info-Net Services:

A computerized system operates at the Training Base that provides soldiers and staff with guidance about daily life at the base, including information on courses, training, events, times, and more. Access to information is subject to the user's permission levels.

mapa.title: Base Map
mapa.content: A general orientation map of the Training Base. For more details and specific signage, you can use the electronic signage and dedicated navigation applications.
